metadata.title: CVE-2019-10197 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in samba versions 4.9.x up to 4.9.13, samba 4.10.x up to4.10.8 and samba 4.11.x up to 4.11.0rc3, when certain parameters were setin the samba configuration file. An unauthenticated attacker could use thisflaw to escape the shared directory and access the contents of directoriesoutside the share.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10197` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.11').
